newsitem.title: USA: Small plane crashes in Birmingham - FAA.
newsitem.headline: Small plane crashes in Birmingham - FAA.

text.p: A spokesman for the Federal Aviation Administration said a small plane had crashed early on Monday in this Alabama city, but said he could not confirm any injuries or deaths.
The Cable News Network reported the plane had crashed into a residential area and that there may have been casualties.
The FAA official in Atlanta said the small plane, a Piper PA-34, crashed at 7:20 A.M. CST (8:20 a.m. EST) (1320 GMT).
He said it was on its way to Pensacola, Florida, when it crashed "in an unknown circumstance."
No further information on the accident was immediately available.
